answers.text: a network between government research laboratories and participating departments of universities

qas.question: what happened to the internet in the late 1980s?

answers.text: a process was set in place towards public, commercial use of the Internet

qas.question: When were remaining restrictions on the internet removed?
how long after the introduction of the world wide web was 1995?
What was developed as a way for various universities to communicate with each other?

plausible_answers.text: process was set in place towards public, commercial use of the Internet

qas.question: What process was set up by the early 1980s?
When was the Internet further restricted?
What happened four years after the introduction of the World Wide Web?

context: <b5_0>The Internet<b5_0/> was developed as <a0_0>a network between government research laboratories and participating departments of universities<a0_0/>. By the late <a1_0>1980s<a1_0/>, <a2_0>a <b6_0>process was set in place towards public, commercial use of the Internet<b6_0/><a2_0/>. <b8_0>The remaining restrictions were removed<b8_0/> by <a3_0><b7_0>1995<b7_0/><a3_0/>, <a4_0>4 years<a4_0/> after the introduction of the World Wide Web.
